intro: Mancoa stylosa, commonly known as the slender mancoa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces small, yellowish or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Mancoa stylosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
